newsitem.title: USA: US spot LPGs steady in dead late trade.
newsitem.headline: US spot LPGs steady in dead late trade.

text.p: U.S. liquefied petroleum gas prices were assessed largely steady in dead trade on Tuesday due to a charity golf tournament that thinned activity.
Spot propane in the U.S. Gulf Coast Mont Belvieu trading hub was assessed steady between 35.00 cents and 35.25 cents a gallon.
Conway, Kansas, hub material was notional, although at midday it was on parity with Belvieu.
The ethane markets were also largely steady, with purity slightly lower at 19.75/20.00 cents and mix at 18.50/18.75 cents.
Traders this morning attributed Tuesday's earlier weakness to selling by Warren, the natural natural gas liquids business of NGC Corp.

The sell off comes following an NGC announcement last week that it will record charges of up to $28 million in the first quarter. The charges include hedging-related losses in the natural gas liquids business and a write-down on the cost of the inventory. ((--Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk 1212 859-1631))
